channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Who are the figure skaters representing Team USA? Key names and backstories to know
item.description: Sixteen U.S. figure skaters are competing in all four Olympic disciplines: men's, women's, pairs and ice dance. The team includes a mix of seasoned ve...

item.title: How to responsibly recycle your children's old toys
item.description: Now that the holiday gift-giving season is over, parents may be looking for ways to recycle or donate their children's old toys. Here's what you need ...

item.title: How IVF has led to a record number of single moms in their 40s
item.description: Who gets to be a parent has been reshaped by IVF: Single women in their 40s are increasingly opting to become moms.

item.title: Marrying for health insurance? The ACA cost crisis forces some drastic choices
item.description: While Congress debates bringing back Affordable Care Act subsidies , many Americans have already made life-altering decisions to afford health care.

item.title: Exercise is as effective as medication in treating depression, study finds
item.description: New research shows exercise is as effective as medication at reducing symptoms of depression. And you don't need to run a marathon to see benefits. So...

item.title: Watch: Moment skier and dog swept along by avalanche
item.description: Footage recorded by Spanish skier Ares Masip shows the incident on Pic de l'Hortell, a mountain in Andorra.

item.title: He once criticised African leaders who cling to power. Now he wants a seventh term
item.description: Yoweri Museveni, 81, says he has brought stability to Uganda. His critics complain of political oppression.

item.title: Nurses strike begins in New York City as thousands walk off jobs
item.description: The largest nurses strike ever in New York City is underway as thousands walk off their jobs at major hospitals.

item.title: Nigerian stars dominate All Africa Music Awards
item.description: Global superstar Burna Boy claimed the prestigious Album of the Year award for his latest work No Sign of Weakness.

item.title: George Floyd and Renee Good: 5 years between Minneapolis videos, and confusion has increased
Thousands of tourists stranded in Lapland as cold grounds flights
item.description: All flights out of Kittila airport in northern Finland were cancelled on Sunday with temperatures falling as low as -38C.

item.title: US justice department opens criminal probe into Fed chair Jerome Powell
item.description: Powell calls the probe "unprecedented" following his refusal to cut interest rates despite demands by Donald Trump.

item.title: Maxim Naumov makes U.S. Olympic team 1 year after parents killed in crash
item.description: Maxim Naumov, a Massachusetts figure skater whose parents were killed last year in a Washington, D.C. plane crash, is headed to the 2026 Olympics.

item.title: Barbie with autism being introduced by Mattel
item.description: Mattel is introducing a Barbie with autism as the newest member of its line intended to celebrate diversity.

item.title: Bride and groom among 8 killed in gas explosion at wedding
item.description: The father of the groom said his wife and sister-in-law were also killed in the explosion, BBC News reported.

item.title: RFK Jr.'s MAHA movement has picked up steam in statehouses
item.description: "Make America Healthy Again" policies driven by HHS Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. have made major strides in state legislatures, with food additives...

item.title: A Minneapolis church holds a service of ‘Lament and Hope’ amid fears over immigration crackdown
Video captures Minneapolis immigration arrest in a city on edge after shooting of Renee Good
item.description: Federal agents are carrying out immigration arrests in Minnesota’s Twin Cities region already shaken by the fatal shooting of a woman.
